meanings.definition: Resist an attack made on (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: I will defend my friend from the bully.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers defend their country from enemies.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight rushed to defend the princess from the dragon.
meanings.sent4: The goalkeeper must defend the goal like a fortress.
meanings.sent5: She trained hard to defend herself in case of danger.

meanings.definition: Speak or write in favor of (an action or person)
meanings.sent1: I will defend my favorite book to anyone who criticizes it.
meanings.sent2: Lawyers defend their clients in court.
meanings.sent3: The student passionately defended his choice of topic for the debate.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was so powerful, it felt like she was defending a noble cause.
meanings.sent5: He always defends his beliefs with strong arguments.

meanings.definition: Guard or protect from harm or danger
meanings.sent1: The dog will defend the house from intruders.
meanings.sent2: Parents defend their children from harm.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission is to defend the city from villains.
meanings.sent4: The thick walls of the castle defend it from attacks.
meanings.sent5: She wore sunscreen to defend her skin from the sun.
